tournament.name: Weekly Duel Commander - Academia de Jogos - 10/03

decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw while utilizing Jori En, Ruin Diver's ability to draw cards whenever you cast your second spell each turn. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their threats, removing their key creatures, and maintaining card advantage. It includes a range of instants, sorceries, and creatures that can provide flexibility in different situations. The deck also includes some powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden to further control the board and manipulate card advantage. Overall, the goal is to out-value the opponent and establish dominance through control and resource management.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize the commander Yisan, the Wanderer Bard, to quickly assemble a board full of powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggro pressure. The deck focuses on ramping up mana early on with mana dorks and land ramp spells, allowing for Yisan to activate his ability multiple times in a turn to fetch creatures of increasing cmc. The deck also includes various utility creatures and spells to help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to ramp quickly, build a board presence with efficient creatures, and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Jenara, Asura of War as the Commander to lead an aggressive strategy in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on efficiently ramping into powerful threats while controlling the board with disruptive creatures and versatile spells. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive game plan, with a mix of dual lands and mana creatures to ensure consistent mana production. The deck includes a variety of powerful creatures and disruptive spells to maintain board advantage and pressure the opponent. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to quickly establish a commanding board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive elements.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering and disrupting your opponent's plays while using card advantage and powerful spells to maintain board control. Keranos, God of Storms acts as a versatile win condition and card advantage engine, providing a steady stream of damage and card draw. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw spells to control the tempo of the game. Additionally, there are powerful finishers like Bonfire of the Damned and Comet Storm to close out the game once you have established control. Overall, this deck aims to out value and out maneuver your opponent in a slow and methodical manner until you can secure the win.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, using Kytheon, Hero of Akros as the Commander. The deck includes a low mana curve with a focus on White creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Leonin Arbiter, and Spirit of the Labyrinth slow down the opponent's strategy, while efficient creatures like Crusader','','');">Mirran Crusader, Hero of Bladehold, and Soltari Champion deliver powerful attacks. The deck also includes cards like Armageddon and Winter Orb to disrupt the opponent's resources and maintain the advantage. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly overpower the opponent and secure a victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to focus on aggressive plays and disruption, utilizing Tymaret, the Murder King as the commander. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, discard effects, and powerful creatures to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. By combining efficiency with versatile threats, the deck aims to control the game and force opponents into unfavorable positions. The inclusion of cards like Bitterblossom, Liliana of the Veil, and creatures like Falkenrath Aristocrat and Grave Titan provide additional value and long-term advantage. Overall, the deck prioritizes early aggression, disruption, and card advantage to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in one-on-one duels.

This deck focuses on utilizing control spells and effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting its own threats. Wydwen, the Biting Gale serves as a versatile commander, allowing for instant-speed interaction with the opponent's spells and creatures. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw options to ensure that it can consistently answer threats and maintain card advantage. In addition, the deck includes powerful creatures like Vendilion Clique and True-Name Nemesis, along with equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly once control is established. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Wasteland and Dust Bowl to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck revolves around using Yisan, the Wanderer Bard to tutor for key utility creatures and combo pieces to disrupt the opponent and win the game quickly. It focuses on ramping with mana dorks and lands like Gaea's Cradle to accelerate Yisan's ability to search for creatures at different converted mana costs. The deck includes a toolbox of creatures to answer various threats, such as Acidic Slime for removal, Thrun, the Last Troll for protection, and Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning finish. The deck also includes cards like Birthing Pod and Survival of the Fittest to tutor for specific creatures and maintain a strong board presence. Overall, the strategy involves efficient ramping and creature tutoring to outpace and outvalue the opponent.
